name: overstimulated
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
too excited or interested in something: Children become so overstimulated by heavy schedules of activities that they can't sleep at night. In our electronic age we are overstimulated, overworked and yet somehow under-skilled.
made to grow or develop too much, or to be too active: In our current overstimulated society that is so mechanical and industrial, there is a hunger for high-level, human-crafted products. They argue that modern racial discrimination is an overstimulated response to what might be called an "alliance" detector in the human brain.
biology
  specialized producing too much of a particular substance or having too great an effect on a process: The pancreas becomes overstimulated and produces too much insulin. With lupus, an overstimulated immune system attacks the body.
